config.question: Why does the Dred Scott case exemplify the “American dilemma”?

choices.content: It represented the Asian American struggle against prejudice and discrimination.
The Supreme Court ruled against white slave owners, denying them the social dominance to which they were accustomed.
The ruling denied an entire category of people--African American slaves--basic rights and freedoms given to U.S. citizens.
The ruling banned white ethnic Americans from well-paid industry jobs, denying them the privileges given to other ethnic groups.

answer_2.response:
Consider this: Sociologist Gunnar Myrdal defined the American dilemma as a democratic society’s denial of basic rights and freedoms to one category of people. How does this play into the decision of the Dred Scott case?
Refer to Learning Objective 11.5 : Assess the social standing of racial and ethnic categories of U.S. society.
